bibl.title: Hisayo Kuwahara v. Henry M. White. Order Granting Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States District Court
For the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the petition of Sakutaro Kuwahara for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the United States District Court
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus.
In the Matter of the Petition of Sakutaro Kuwahara for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

In this cause the order to show cause why a writ of Habeas Corpus should not issue, heretofore granted herein on the 21st day of January, 1920, having come on for hearing on the 26th day of January, 1920, and having been by the Court continued to the 2nd day of February, 1920, and on that day the matter having been submitted upon the argument of counsel, the Court took the same under advisement, and having on the 4th day of February, 1920, filed an opinion and decision herein granting and allowing the Writ;

It is by the Court ORDERED and CONSIDERED, and the court does hereby ORDER AND CONSIDER, that a Writ of Habeas Corpus do issue herein to Henry M.White, United States Commissioner of Immigration at the Port of Seattle, commanding him that he do produce the body of Hisayo Kuwahara before this Court on the 7th day of February, 1920, at the hour of 10:00 o'clock A.M., then and there to be dealt with according to law.
Done in Open Court this 4 day of February, 1920.
